summary: This document is a response from Navy Federal Credit Union to a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated August 19, 2019. It includes the subpoena, a detailed rider requesting extensive financial records for accounts from January 1, 2019 onward, a declaration of custodian of records, and reimbursement paperwork. The subpoena relates to an investigation into alleged violations of federal statutes including bribery, conspiracy, false statements, and fraud.

persons.name: Shelby Polk
persons.context: Employee of Navy Federal Credit Union who signed the certification statement and is the point of contact for the subpoena response, providing the password for the enclosed disk.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the grand jury subpoena and the reimbursement procedure letter.

persons.name: Karon Chitner
persons.context: Notary public who notarized Shelby Polk's certification statement.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to Navy Federal Credit Union, demanding financial records and a potential appearance.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands Navy Federal Credit Union to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in New York, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced by the return date.

events.title: Subpoena Response Submitted
events.description: Navy Federal Credit Union sends its response to the grand jury subpoena, enclosing requested documents and a certification statement.

locations: Navy Federal Credit Union, 820 Follin Lane, Vienna, VA 22180-4907
United States Attorney's Office, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office - SDNY Accounts Payable, 86 Chambers Street, 3rd floor, New York, NY 10007
Navy Federal Credit Union, PO Box 3000, Merrifield, VA 22119-3000
keyFacts: The grand jury subpoena seeks extensive financial records from Navy Federal Credit Union for accounts from January 1, 2019 onward, including transaction details, wire transfers, and customer information.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal statutes including bribery (18 U.S.C. § 201), conspiracy (18 U.S.C. § 371), false statements (18 U.S.C. § 1001), honest services fraud (18 U.S.C. § 1346), and destruction of evidence (18 U.S.C. § 1519).
The subpoena response includes a detailed certification by custodian Shelby Polk, attesting to the authenticity of the business records provided.

The document includes a U.S. Department of Justice form (USA-211) for reimbursement under the Right to Financial Privacy Act, indicating the records pertain to an individual or a partnership of five or fewer individuals.
The subpoena was issued in August 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019, suggesting it is part of the subsequent financial investigation into his affairs.
